post: Need a gift for the holidays? BRI is excited to announce our newest affiliate partnership with History By Mail. History By Mail is a monthly subscription service for reproductions of historical letters and documents. Each replica comes with a separate document explaining the context of the letter, including its author, recipient, and relevance to the events of its time, as well as a transcription when necessary. Use code 'BRI' to receive a discount at checkout, and a portion of your purchase supports BRI helping us provide free civics and history education to classrooms nationwide. . Visit  https://lnkd.in/eNRSQW2C to shop!  #BillofRightsInstitute  #HistoryByMail

At the Bill of Rights Institute, we believe all students deserve access to high-quality civic education. Thats why BRI offers free classroom resources and continually works to expand access for students of all backgrounds. Our Civics for Everyone initiative is made possible by a coalition of partnerstech leaders, corporations, foundations, educational groups, and disability advocateswho share our commitment to helping students learn about our nation, government, and their civic responsibilities. Learn more here  https://lnkd.in/eX8DHCFP or reach out to Justin Goldstein, CAE.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #civicsforeveryone

Yesterday was Bill of Rights Day- the 233rd anniversary of the ratification of the Bill of Rights. On December 15, 1791, rights we hold dear as Americans – like freedom of speech, due process, and the freedom to practice the faith of our choice – became law in our nation. BRI President and CEO David Bobb joined Washington Journal to discuss the story of the Bill of Rights and the importance of teaching young people about the significance of our Founding documents and principles in their everyday lives. Watch the full interview here:  https://lnkd.in/dfWJjJag  #BillofRights  #BillofRightsInstitute

Relive the spirit of the Boston Tea Party this holiday season with Star Spangled Tea. The Boston Tea Party was more than a protest; it was a pivotal moment in American history, symbolizing the fight for liberty and self-governance. On the anniversary, honor that revolutionary spirit by enjoying a cup of tea thats as bold as the ideas that shaped our nation. When you shop at Star Spangled Tea using code BRI1791, a portion of your purchase supports the Bill of Rights Institute, helping us provide free civics and history education to classrooms nationwide. That was the year the Bill of Rights was ratified, putting into law rights everyone should enjoy, like freedom of speech, freedom of religion, and due process.
